intro: Ruellia luzona, commonly known as Luzon bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
